name: Veggie Omelette
description: Colorful vegetable-filled omelette, rich in protein. Light, nutritious breakfast ready in 15 minutes.

instructions.instruction: Wash and prep all vegetables. Place in separate bowls - cooking happens fast.
instructions.tip: French call this 'mise en place' - everything in its place.

instructions.instruction: Crack eggs into a deep bowl. Add milk, salt, and pepper.
Whisk vigorously for 30 seconds with fork or whisk. Yolks and whites should be fully combined.
instructions.tip: Don't overwhisk - just until slightly frothy.

instructions.instruction: Heat non-stick pan (8-9 inch) over medium heat. Add olive oil.
Add peppers and mushrooms. Sauté 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
instructions.tip: Vegetables should stay slightly crisp - don't overcook.

instructions.instruction: Add spinach and stir until wilted (30 seconds).
Transfer sautéed vegetables to a plate. Wipe pan with paper towel.
Return pan to medium-low heat. Add butter and let it melt.
instructions.tip: Heat shouldn't be too high for omelette - outside burns, inside stays raw.

instructions.instruction: Pour beaten eggs into pan. Don't touch for 10 seconds.
Gently push edges toward center with spatula. Tilt pan to let uncooked egg flow to edges.
When top surface is still slightly wet (not runny), add vegetables to one half of omelette.
Fold empty half over the vegetable side using spatula.
Cook 1 more minute on low heat. Cheese should melt.
Slide onto plate. Top with tomatoes, green onion, and pepper flakes. Serve immediately.

tips: Omelette interior should be creamy (baveuse) - French style.
Non-stick pan is essential - regular pans stick.
Take eggs out of fridge 10 minutes early - room temp cooks better.
Customize vegetables based on season and preference.
storageInfo: Best eaten fresh. Omelettes don't keep well - eat immediately.
servingSuggestion: Serve with whole wheat toast, fresh fruit, or side salad.
variations: Cheese: Just use grated cheddar or gruyere.
Spanish tortilla: Thick omelette with potatoes and onions.
Mediterranean: Olives, sun-dried tomatoes, and feta.
Protein-focused: Use 2 whole eggs + 3 egg whites.
